newsitem.title: SPAIN: SOCCER-BETIS WIN TO THREATEN BARCELONA'S SECOND PLACE.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-BETIS WIN TO THREATEN BARCELONA'S SECOND PLACE.

text.p: Real Betis regained third place in the Spanish league on Sunday thanks to goals from strikers Alfonso Perez and Finidi George in a 2-1 home win over struggling Hercules.

A win on Thursday at Sporting Gijon, in a game postponed from January, would leave Betis level on points with Barcelona, who crashed 4-0 at Tenerife on Saturday. Leaders Real Madrid, a further six points ahead, play Espanyol on Monday.
Betis currently hold third place on goal difference ahead of Deportivo Coruna, 2-1 winners at Rayo Vallecano on Saturday, with Atletico Madrid a point behind after their 3-2 win over Sevilla.
Sixth-placed Real Sociedad lost ground a further five points back in a drab Basque derby game with Athletic Bilbao. Athletic stay seventh, trailing their neighbours by four points.

Extremadura continued their extraordinary recovery with a 3-2 win at Racing Santander, while Zaragoza clawed their way out of the relegation zone for the first time in nearly four months by beating Valladolid 1-0.

The results opened up a five-point gap between Extremadura and bottom-but-one club Sevilla. Hercules bring up the rear a further two points back and look almost certain to go straight back to the second division at the end of the season.
